title: Kylie Jenner's daughter Stormi loves 'Rise and Shine' remix as family cash in on lullaby
text:
The video will start in 8 Cancel

Get the biggest celebs stories by email Subscribe Thank you for subscribing We have more newsletters Show me See our privacy notice Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email

Kylie Jenner has begun merchandising the viral phrase through her own website in order to bring in more cash.

The Kardashian-Jenner family are known for grabbing opportunities to monetise anything and everything - so it's no surprise that the 22-year-old has taken this sudden chance.

The clip emerged when Kylie sang briefly to daughter Stormi in her Kylie Cosmetics office, and it blew up across the Internet. That's all it took.

She's already in talks with pop-star Ariana Grande to sample the viral clip that has given her the spotlight.

"Rise and Shine" has been impossible to escape for a week now, as fans love it so much.

The business mogul took it to the extreme on Thursday morning as she posted a picture of her face posing as the iconic sun from the Teletubbies.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

"No caption needed," she joked.

But she's using this opportunity to her advantage, as the star has now released a collection of hoodies with "Riise" and "Shiiinnee" penned on the sleeves - with her own face as the sun.

(Image: @kyliejenner/Instagram)

As much as everyone is loving Kylie's viral lullaby, she's gained at least one critic and that's Stormi.

"You like it?" Kylie asked her daughter, but Stormi hit back with a question of her own. "Daddy sing?"

(Image: @kyliejenner/Instagram)

And when Kylie clarified that it was mommy singing, Stormi actually turned off the music and repeated, "Daddy sing." Only this time it wasn't a question.

(Image: @kyliejenner/Instagram)

"Oh, I'm not good enough?" Kylie quizzed, while Stormi simply repeated, "Daddy sing!"

In Kylie's defeat, she captioned the video: "Daddy's girl," with rolled eye and heart eye emojis.
description: The young self-made billionaire is cashing in on the viral phrase
